topic.title: Create Users and Assign Roles
topic.shortdesc: To perform application access-testing, create users and assign different roles to them.

section.title: User-Creation Process
section.p: The process of user-creation and role-assignment was described in the section RBAC for Administrators and Applications. You will now use this process to create three users, each of whom has a different combination of roles.

section.title: Create a Reader
section.p: Left-click on the Security tab to bring up the Security view, and then left-click on the + Add User button, at the upper right. When the Manage User dialog appears, specify a Username of composersReader. Then, access the Role(s) dialog. Open the data Roles and Data Reader sections of the roles hierarchy, and check the Data Reader checkbox for the composers bucket. The dialog now appears as follows:
Now left-click on the Save button. The Security view now appears as follows:

section.title: Create a Writer
section.p: Within the Security view, again left-click on the + Add User button. When the Manage User dialog appears, specify a Username of composersWriter. Then, access the Role(s) dialog. Open the data Roles and Data Reader Writer sections of the roles hierarchy, and check the Data Reader Writer checkbox for the composers bucket. Then, left-lick on the Save button. This saves your second user-definition, and returns you again to the Security view.

section.title: Create an Index Writer
section.p: It should be noted that Couchbase RBAC considers index-creation to be a special privilege; distinct from the privileges of writing production and general administrative data. Therefore, to create an index, the appropriate role must be assigned the user.

Within the Security view, again left-click on the + Add User button. When the Manage User dialog appears, specify a Username of composersIndexMaker. Then, access the Role(s) dialog. Open the query Roles and Query Manage Index sections of the roles hierarchy, and check the Query Manage Index checkbox for the composers bucket. Then, left-lick on the Save button. This saves your second user-definition, and returns you again to the Security view. This now appears as follows:

section.title: Next
section.p: This concludes your creation of users. You can now use the Couchbase cbq tool to test the degree of each has to the composers buckets, based on the roles you have assigned to them. Proceed to the next section, Perform cbq Access Tests.
